messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/admin.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\MediaLibraryController` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/media`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/admin.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\MediaLibraryController`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Files containing the handler implementations for App\Http\Controllers\Admin\MediaLibraryController:

- app/Http/Controllers/Admin/MediaLibraryController.php

Explanation and notes:
- I searched the project for the controller class and opened the file app/Http/Controllers/Admin/MediaLibraryController.php. This file defines the MediaLibraryController class and implements the following action methods used by the admin routes:
  - index(Request $request): returns the media library view
  - show(Media $medium): returns a Media model instance
  - create(Request $request): returns the media creation form view
  - store(MediaLibraryRequest $request): handles image upload and redirects
  - destroy(Media $medium): deletes a media item and redirects
- The admin routes (routes/admin.php) register a resource route for "media" and limit it to the methods index, show, create, store, destroy â€” these correspond exactly to the methods implemented in the controller file above.
- The controller depends on these supporting classes (useful when producing an OpenAPI spec):
  - app/Http/Requests/Admin/MediaLibraryRequest.php (request validation for store)
  - app/Models/Media.php
  - app/Models/MediaLibrary.php

Only the controller file contains the handler implementations; the other files are supporting request/model classes referenced by those handlers.
